robot

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.Search

  • public class Search
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that allows the robot to search the enemy zone for the flag.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Shawn Lu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Search(ObjectDetector detector, FlagCapturer arm, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor sensorMotor)
      Default constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean check(double x, double y, int colornum)
      check method: go close to check the color of block, if the block disappeared, move 3cm back along y-axis and scan again, if it actually checked the block, move 12cm back along y-axis to avoid duplicated checking and continue scan
      void drop()
      Method to place the captured block down behind the robot.
      void grab()
      method to capture the flag: move backwards a bit, put down the arm, and move forwards a bit, then lift arm up to capture flag
      void putdown()
      Method to place the captured block down
      boolean scan(Point2D point1, Point2D point3, int deg, int degrotate, int colornum)
      scan method: go backwards along the y-axis to scan.
      void searching(Point2D point1, Point2D point2, Point2D point3, int colornum)
      main searching method

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Search

        public Search(ObjectDetector detector,
              FlagCapturer arm,
              EV3LargeRegulatedMotor sensorMotor)
        Default constructor
        Parameters:
        detector - the ObjectDetector
        arm - the FlagCapturer
        sensorMotor - the motor that controls the movement of the sensor arm.

    • Method Detail

      • searching

        public void searching(Point2D point1,
                      Point2D point2,
                      Point2D point3,
                      int colornum)
        main searching method
        Parameters:
        point1: - the bottom left point of the enemy zone
        point2: - the top right point of the enemy zone
        point3: - the point of the home zone
        colornum: - the number of color of the target flag

      • scan

        public boolean scan(Point2D point1,
                    Point2D point3,
                    int deg,
                    int degrotate,
                    int colornum)
        scan method: go backwards along the y-axis to scan. if sensor sees a block, turn to facing block and go close to check it. the robot keeps scanning until it moves out the enemy zone
        Parameters:
        point1 - the coordinates of the bottom left corner of the enemy zone
        point3 - the coordinates of the top right corner of the enemy zone
        deg - the amount of degrees the sensor motor is expected to turn
        degrotate - the amount of degrees to add to get the robot to rotate towards
        colornum - the color number of the flag to scan for. (Color indices defined in ObjectDetector class)
        Returns:

      • check

        public boolean check(double x,
                     double y,
                     int colornum)
        check method: go close to check the color of block, if the block disappeared, move 3cm back along y-axis and scan again, if it actually checked the block, move 12cm back along y-axis to avoid duplicated checking and continue scan
        Parameters:
        x,y: - the position where robot should go back after color detection
        colornum: - the number of color of the target flag

      • grab

        public void grab()
        method to capture the flag: move backwards a bit, put down the arm, and move forwards a bit, then lift arm up to capture flag

      • putdown

        public void putdown()
        Method to place the captured block down

      • drop

        public void drop()
        Method to place the captured block down behind the robot.
